src:
Progres Pembangunan Bandara Kulon Progo hingga Lombok
04 Nov 2019, 04:47 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana

Jakarta - Pembangunan infrastruktur dan konektivitas menjadi fokus pemerintahan Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi). Pembangunan infrastruktur itu di antaranya dilakukan oleh Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) atau AP I.AP I sendiri saat ini tengah melakukan pengembangan sejumlah bandara antara lain Bandara Internasional Yogyakarta (YIA) di Kulon Progo, Bandara Syamsudin Noor Banjarmasin, Bandara Lombok Praya, dan Bandara Sultan Hasanuddin Makassar."Seiring dengan fokus pemerintah pada pengembangan infrastruktur transportasi tersebut, Angkasa Pura I juga terus mendorong pengembangan beberapa bandaranya di wilayah tengah dan timur Indonesia," kata Direktur Utama AP I Faik Fahmi dalam keterangan resminya, Senin (4/11/2019).Bagaimana progres pembangunan bandara-bandara tersebut? Berikut rinciannya:Bandara Syamsudin Noor BanjarmasinHingga 20 Oktober 2019, progres proyek pengembangan Bandara Syamsudin Noor Banjarmasin yang masuk dalam proyek strategis nasional (PSN) sudah mencapai 93,6%. Bandara ini ditargetkan dapat mulai dioperasikan dan diresmikan pada akhir 2019.Dengan adanya terminal baru ini akan menambah kapasitas terminal penumpang menjadi 7 juta penumpang per tahun, lebih besar hampir 5 kali lipat dari kapasitas terminal lama yang hanya dapat menampung 1,5 juta penumpang per tahun. Pada 2018 lalu, Bandara Syamsudin Noor Banjarmasin melayani 3,9 juta penumpang, naik 7,1% dibanding trafik penumpang pada 2017.Proyek pengembangan Bandara Syamsudin Noor Banjarmasin menelan dana sekitar Rp 2 triliun. Pengembangan ini terdiri pembangunan terminal baru, perluasan apron, dan perluasan terminal kargo. Setelah selesai 100%, luas terminal penumpang bertambah menjadi 77.569 meter persegi (kapasitas 7 juta penumpang per tahun) dari 9.043 meter persegi (kapasitas 1,6 juta penumpang per tahun).Sementara, luas apron bertambah menjadi 129.812 meter persegi yang dapat menampung 16 pesawat narrow body dari 80.412 meter persegi yang hanya dapat menampung 8 pesawat narrow body. Sedangkan perluasan terminal kargo tahap 1 nantinya akan dapat menampung 44.000 ton per tahun dari 22.297 ton per tahun.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>> (ang/ang)
text:
Progress of Kulon Progo Airport Development to Lombok
Nov 04 2019, 04:47 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana

Jakarta - Infrastructure development and connectivity are the focus of the administration of President Joko Widodo (Jokowi). The infrastructure development was carried out by PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) or AP I.AP I itself is currently developing a number of airports including Yogyakarta International Airport (YIA) in Kulon Progo, Syamsudin Noor Airport Banjarmasin, Lombok Praya Airport, and Sultan Hasanuddin Makassar Airport. "Along with the government's focus on developing the transportation infrastructure, Angkasa Pura I also continues to encourage the development of several airports in the central and eastern regions of Indonesia," said Director of AP I Faik Fahmi in his official statement , Monday (11/04/2019). How is the progress of the construction of these airports? Here are the details: Syamsudin Noor Airport Banjarmasin Until October 20, 2019, the progress of the Syamsudin Noor Airport Banjarmasin development project that was included in the national strategic project (PSN) has reached 93.6%. The airport is targeted to be operational and inaugurated by the end of 2019. With this new terminal, it will increase the capacity of the passenger terminal to 7 million passengers per year, almost 5 times greater than the capacity of the old terminal which can only accommodate 1.5 million passengers per year . In 2018, Banjarmasin Syamsudin Noor Airport served 3.9 million passengers, an increase of 7.1% compared to passenger traffic in 2017. The Syamsudin Noor Airport development project in Banjarmasin cost around Rp 2 trillion. This development consists of building a new terminal, expanding the apron, and expanding the cargo terminal. After completing 100%, the passenger terminal area has increased to 77,569 square meters (capacity of 7 million passengers per year) from 9,043 square meters (capacity of 1.6 million passengers per year). Meanwhile, the area of aprons has increased to 129,812 square meters which can accommodate 16 aircraft a narrow body of 80,412 square meters which can only accommodate 8 narrow body aircraft. While the expansion of phase 1 cargo terminal will be able to accommodate 44,000 tons per year from 22,297 tons per year. Continue to the next page >>> (ang / ang)
